name: Default Assessment Template
description: Template for generating educational assessments with Stoic principles

sections.name: Introduction
sections.content:
# Assessment: {{concept.name}}

This assessment will evaluate your understanding of {{concept.name}}. Designed for {{age_range}} learners at a {{difficulty}} level.

sections.name: Instructions
sections.content:
## Instructions

This assessment includes multiple types of questions to evaluate your understanding of {{concept.name}}. Answer each question to the best of your ability.

sections.name: Multiple Choice Questions
sections.content:
## Multiple Choice

Select the best answer for each question:

1. What is the primary purpose of {{concept.name}}?
   a) Option A
   b) Option B
   c) Option C
   d) Option D

2. Which of the following best describes a key principle of {{concept.name}}?
   a) Option A
   b) Option B
   c) Option C
   d) Option D

3. In what context would {{concept.name}} be most appropriately applied?
   a) Option A
   b) Option B
   c) Option C
   d) Option D

sections.name: Short Answer Questions
sections.content:
## Short Answer

1. Define {{concept.name}} in your own words and explain its significance.

2. Describe one practical application of {{concept.name}}.

3. How does {{concept.name}} relate to other concepts in this field?

sections.name: Essay Question
sections.content:
## Essay

Write a well-structured essay (250-500 words) addressing the following:

Explain the importance of {{concept.name}} in its field, discuss its practical applications, and analyze any limitations or critiques. Include specific examples to support your points.

sections.name: Stoic Reflection
sections.content:
## Stoic Reflection

1. How can a Stoic approach help in learning and applying {{concept.name}}?

2. Describe how the Stoic virtues (wisdom, courage, justice, temperance) might apply to the study and application of {{concept.name}}.

3. What aspects of mastering {{concept.name}} are within your control, and what aspects might require acceptance of things beyond your control?

sections.name: Conclusion
sections.content:
## Conclusion

Reflect on your answers and consider how they demonstrate your understanding of {{concept.name}}. Remember that assessment is not just about evaluation, but also an opportunity for learning and growth.
